Priority List

last update on Jan 11, 2020 • for 8.3.0 Battle for Azeroth

Месть

  • Гайд
  • Мифик+

Table of Contents

  • Single target / two targets
    • Special cases
  • AoE (3 or more targets)
  • Openers
  • Common misconceptions and mistakes

The elemental priority is fairly straightforward — the choice of which spell to cast next is often easy to make. The only issue you might face will be to learn the different ways the priorities shift with different talents. We have done our best to condense the SimulationCraft Action Priority List (APL) into a human-readable, easy to understand form. If you want to investigate any minor details, please refer to the APL in SimulationCraft or contact us on Discord.

After reading the APL, please pay attention to the special mentions below, because we couldn’t fit all special cases and handling into the readable formated APL.

If you have suggestions with sim evidence to back them up, please let us know on Discord.

Single target / two targets

Talent selector:

15
30
60
90
100
  1. Cast Meteor / Eye of the Storm if no multi-target will happen soon. Make sure Storm Elemental buffs itself with Call Lightning before you activate Eye of the Storm.
  2. Cast Totem Mastery when any of the following are true:
    • It is not active or you are out of range of the existing totems.
    • You are about to enter Ascendance, and the buff would expire during Ascendance.
  3. Cast Fire Elemental / Storm Elemental / Earth Elemental on cooldown. But don't screw your group with Earth Elemental.
  4. Cast Flame Shock when any of the following are true:
    • It is not active on the target.
    • You are about to enter Ascendance.
    • The debuff's duration is at or below 7 seconds remaining.
    • Special warning: Don't refresh Flame Shock if you have 14 stacks or more of Wind Gust during Storm Elemental. Unless you have Igneous Potential at least twice.
  5. Cast Ascendance on cooldown, if neither Storm Elemental is active, nor Lava Burst is available, nor Icefury is active.
  6. Cast Elemental Blast on cooldown, if neither Storm Elemental is active nor you could cast a Master of the Elements empowered Earth Shock instead.
  7. Cast Stormkeeper on cooldown and ideally game it with Surge of Power if you selected this talent. See special cases below for more information.
  8. Cast Liquid Magma Totem on cooldown. Ideally paired with Worldvein Resonance, if that's your major essence.
  9. Cast Earthquake if you're fighting 2 or more enemies and it can do at least 8 ticks. If you use Lava Shock this changes to using Earthquake at three or more targets.
  10. Cast Lightning Bolt if Stormkeeper is active and when any of the following are true (if you don't see any following conditions, ignore this line):
    • Master of the Elements is active and Surge of Power is NOT selected.
    • Surge of Power is active.
  11. Cast Earth Shock. But read the special cases about delaying Earth Shock casts.
  12. Cast Lava Burst while Storm Elemental is active if any of the following conditions are met:
    • You have 2 or more Igneous Potential traits.
    • You have a Lava Surge proc.
    • You have fewer than 14 Wind Gust stacks.
  13. Cast Lightning Bolt if Storm Elemental is active.
  14. Cast Frost Shock with the Icefury buff and Master of the Elements buff active.
  15. Cast Lava Burst if Ascendance is active.
  16. Cast Lava Burst with Surge of Power if you could get another use out of Storm Elemental/Fire Elemental or lengthen its last possible duration within the fight.
  17. Cast Lightning Bolt with Surge of Power buff active.
  18. Cast Lava Burst.
  19. Cast Frost Shock with the Icefury buff active.
  20. Cast Icefury on cooldown.
  21. Refresh Totem Mastery if its duration is at or below 9 seconds remaining.
  22. Cast Lightning Bolt as a filler.
  23. Cast Frost Shock in place of Lightning Bolt while moving, even if you do not have Icefury.

Special cases

Master of the Elements

  • Change: Delay Earth Shock to cast it with Master of the Elements instead.
  • Priority of casts you want to empower with Master of the Elements from best to worst:
    1. Earthquake if two or more targets are in its effect (unless Lava Shock is present at low target count )
    2. Lightning Bolt with Stormkeeper
    3. Earth Shock
    4. Frost Shock with Icefury
    5. Lightning Bolt
    6. Icefury
    7. Frost Shock

Storm Elemental + Elemental Blast

  • Active Azerite: 3x Natural Harmony
  • Change: You keep casting Elemental Blast until you reach 14 stacks of Wind Gust

Stormkeeper + Surge of Power

  • Change: You pool Maelstrom before casting Stormkeeper to combo both empowered Lightning Bolt with Surge of Power
  • Example cast sequence:
    • Pool to 96+MS
    • Earth Shock
    • Stormkeeper
    • Lightning Bolt
    • Lava Burst
    • Earth Shock
    • Lightning Bolt

Storm Elemental + Primal Elementalist

Combining Storm Elemental with Primal Elementalist enables access to Eye of the Storm. This powerful ability needs to be activated manually. Make sure to use it shortly after your Storm Elemental buffs itself with Call Lightning. Eye of the Storm is an incredible AoE CD and very useful for single target as well. Check out our FAQ for macros if you need help with that.

Surge of Power + 2 targets

  • Change: as long as both targets don’t have Flame Shock or are in refreshable duration and spread range, use Earth Shock once to spread Flame Shock to both with Surge of Power.

AoE (3 or more targets)

  1. Cast Meteor / Eye of the Storm against as many targets as possible. Make sure Storm Elemental buffs itself with Call Lightning before you activate Eye of the Storm.
  2. Cast Totem Mastery when any of the following are true:
    1. It is not active.
    2. The buff's duration is at or below 9 seconds remaining.
  3. Cast Fire Elemental / Storm Elemental / Earth Elemental on cooldown (see the warning about Primal Elementalist).
  4. Cast Stormkeeper on cooldown.
  5. Cast Liquid Magma Totem on cooldown.
  6. Maintain 3 Flame Shocks if there are 3 targets.
  7. Cast Earthquake when available. (Try gaming Master of the Elements.)
  8. Cast Lava Burst to consume Lava Surge procs when Storm Elemental is not active and you're fighting only 3 targets.
  9. Cast Elemental Blast if there are 3 targets.
  10. Cast Chain Lightning.

Special mention Flame Shock can be maintained at 4 targets and should be, if you can ensure that they all live at least 80% of the duration. Because this is usually not the case, we opted to write 3 as the maximum number of spreads. Tread carefully, as this could otherwise backfire.

Special mention There are many caveats with Master of the Elements when in AoE situations. IF you have two or more Igneous Potential equipped, it is generally worth using Lava Surge procs to empower Earthquakes, even on 4+ targets. On more than 4 targets, only apply flame shock to one of the targets, ideally a target with higher health than the rest. Use Lava Surge procs on the afflicted target in order to empower Earthquake. With this in mind, be careful not to overdo it; it will very likely result in a loss of DPS if enemies die before your Earthquake finishes ticking when you could have used the spell earlier.

Openers

Follow the cast sequences below for your chosen opener. A red arrow indicates the time the boss is pulled. Please note that openers are a very minor and nit-picky increase (or sometimes decrease!), and adapting to the fight is much more important.

Standard raid opener:

SK
TM
LvB
FS
FE
LB
IF


Common misconceptions and mistakes

“I should try and play around Master of the Elements!”

The only time you should adjust your gameplay for Master of the Elements is when you have the liberty to cast a spell later with a MotE buff versus now – this means for a spell like Earth Shock, you can make the decision to wait until you have the Master of the Elements buff active before casting it (this is reflected in the priority above). This is thanks to the low urgency of Earth Shock casts, as you are not constrained by a cooldown or Maelstrom cast, since you can cast it at any point between 60 and 100 Maelstrom.

“I should cast Lightning Bolt during Ascendance if I have some powerful buffs for it active!”

During Ascendance you only want to spend your time casting Lava Burst and Earth Shock. Yes you’ll waste Master of the Elements but that’s fine.

“I should cast Elemental Blast during Ascendance!”

No. Elemental Blast doesn’t deal enough damage by quite a significant margin.

“I should cast Icefury with Master of the Elements during Ascendance!”

No. Your Ascendance is ideally used when Icefury is on cooldown and won’t get ready while you’re casting Lava Burst.

“I should only cast Lightning Bolt / Chain Lightning during Storm Elemental!”

With 2 or more Igneous Potential: Keep using Lava Burst on single target.

Else: During single target you’ll want to only cast Lightning Bolt and Earth Shock. During AoE Chain Lightning becomes quickly more worth than Lava Burst. Nonetheless you should use Earthquake.

“I should cast Flame Shock at 7.2 seconds remaining or lower!”

That’s correct but which human is able to accurately judge the difference between 7.2 seconds and 7 seconds. So we decided to present the easier to digest number in the priority list.

“I should cast Totem Mastery at less than 9 seconds remaining!”

Yes, the shorter the remaining duration, the less likely it is for you to need an additional cast of it over the whole fight. But because that is quite unlikely already, 9 is a good rule of thumbs. The overall dps won’t budge with that change.

“I should try to keep Natural Harmony active with Frost Shock!”

No.
